byline.contributor: Mohamed Ibrahim contributed reporting from Mogadishu, Somalia.

abstract: Group of men claiming to be members of Al Qaeda distribute food to starving Somalis at camp run by militant group Shabab, saying Al Qaeda is eager to help Somalia's famine victims; bizarre incident draws questions and criticism.
snippet: A food giveaway over the weekend to the famine-plagued people in Somalia raises a question: What kind of group is Al Qaeda these days?
lead_paragraph: A food giveaway over the weekend to the famine-plagued people in Somalia raises a question: What kind of group is Al Qaeda these days?

headline.main: Al Qaeda Tries a New Tactic in Somalia: Philanthropy
headline.print_headline: Somalia Food Giveaway in Al Qaeda’s Name Raises Questions and Criticism
headline.seo: Al Qaeda Tries a New Tactic in Somalia: Philanthropy
